{{ddcl|header=stacktrace|since=c++23|1=
template&lt; class Allocator &gt;
struct formatter&lt;std::basic_stacktrace&lt;Allocator&gt;&gt;;
}}

The template specialization of {{lc|std::formatter}} for {{lc|std::basic_stacktrace&lt;Allocator&gt;}} allows users to convert a stacktrace object to string using [[cpp/utility/format|formatting functions]] such as {{lc|std::format}}.

No format specifier is allowed.

A stacktrace object {{c|s}} is formatted as if by copying {{box|{{rlpt|to_string|std::to_string}}{{c/core|(s)}}}} to the output.

===Example===
{{example
| code=
#include &lt;format&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;stacktrace&gt;

int main()
{
    auto trace = std::stacktrace::current();
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::format("{}\n", trace);
}
| p=true
| output=&lt;nowiki/&gt;
 0# 0x0000000000402D97 in ./prog.exe
 1# __libc_start_main in /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
 2# 0x0000000000402CA9 in ./prog.exe
}}
